user_message:
<misra_rule>
MISRA C 2023 Rule 2.1 is: A project shall not contain unreachable code.

</misra_rule>
<response format>
Provide your answer with these fields.
- is_rule_violated: whether the rule is violated or not (true/false),
- scenario: a specific violation scenario.
</response format>
<target_code>
Here is the code of OS_SocketAddrInit_Impl:
```c
int32 OS_SocketAddrInit_Impl(OS_SockAddr_t *Addr, OS_SocketDomain_t Domain)
{
    sa_family_t             sa_family;
    socklen_t               addrlen;
    OS_SockAddr_Accessor_t *Accessor;

    memset(Addr, 0, sizeof(OS_SockAddr_t));
    Accessor = (OS_SockAddr_Accessor_t *)&Addr->AddrData;

    switch (Domain)
    {
        case OS_SocketDomain_INET:
            sa_family = AF_INET;
            addrlen   = sizeof(struct sockaddr_in);
            break;
#ifdef OS_NETWORK_SUPPORTS_IPV6
        case OS_SocketDomain_INET6:
            sa_family = AF_INET6;
            addrlen   = sizeof(struct sockaddr_in6);
            break;
#endif
        default:
            sa_family = 0;
            addrlen   = 0;
            break;
    }

    if (addrlen == 0)
    {
        return OS_ERR_NOT_IMPLEMENTED;
    }

    Addr->ActualLength     = OSAL_SIZE_C(addrlen);
    Accessor->sa.sa_family = sa_family;

    return OS_SUCCESS;
}
```
</target_code>
<additional code>Here are the definitions of symbols that are close to the target function OS_SocketAddrInit_Impl:
typedef enum
{
    OS_SocketDomain_INVALID, /**< @brief Invalid */
    OS_SocketDomain_INET,    /**< @brief IPv4 address family, most commonly used) */
    OS_SocketDomain_INET6,   /**< @brief IPv6 address family, depends on OS/network stack support */
    OS_SocketDomain_MAX      /**< @brief Maximum */
} OS_SocketDomain_t
...
#define OS_NETWORK_SUPPORTS_IPV6 
...
typedef struct
{
    size_t            ActualLength; /**< @brief Length of the actual address data */
    OS_SockAddrData_t AddrData;     /**< @brief Abstract Address data */
} OS_SockAddr_t
</additional code>
<target_code>
Here is the code fragment that you need to analyze:
```c
        default:
            sa_family = 0;
            addrlen   = 0;
            break;
```
Focus on the above code fragment and judge whether it violates the rule 2.1 or not.
</target_code>
scenario: The default branch is reachable when Domain is any value other than OS_SocketDomain_INET or OS_SocketDomain_INET6 — for example OS_SocketDomain_INVALID or OS_SocketDomain_MAX (or any out-of-range value). In that case the default sets sa_family = 0 and addrlen = 0 and the function returns OS_ERR_NOT_IMPLEMENTED. Therefore the default fragment is reachable and not unreachable code.
